attributes.action: Fund a public health campaign on cardiopulmonary resuscitation
attributes.additional_details:
Every year 100,000 people pass away as a result of Sudden Cardiac Arrest (SCA) in the United Kingdom.
CPR is a way to, for that anyone who knows how to do it, save a life of those suffering from a Cardiac Arrest.

If public health advertisements were advertised, both physically and on national television, the 100,000 fatalities from SCA can be limited because of a bystander who knew how to do CPR and did the right thing and helped.
attributes.background: Fund a public health campaign which includes guidance on how to do cardiopulmonary resuscitation and how to help in public places when you see a cardiac arrest, in order to create more understanding of Cardiac Arrests and the ways to prevent fatalities from them.

signatures_by_constituency.mp: Rt Hon Dr Liam Fox MP
signatures_by_constituency.name: North Somerset
